question: The pipe flow in Fig. P6.52 is driven by pressurized air in the tank. What gage pressure p_1 is needed to provide a 20°C water flow rate Q = 60 m^3/h? <image 1>
description: The image depicts a fluid flow system involving a smooth pipe with a diameter \( d = 5 \) cm. The pipe is connected to a pressurized tank at one end and discharges into an open jet at the other end. The tank is filled with water up to a height of 10 meters. The pipe has a horizontal section that extends 60 meters before turning vertically upward for 80 meters, then horizontally again for another 30 meters before discharging into the open jet. The flow rate \( Q \) is given as 60 m³/h. The question asks for the gauge pressure \( p_1 \) required in the tank to achieve this flow rate at 20°C.
